column4: hello, anybody  can tell me if you mount /mnt and /mnt/boot you get the same things but in /mnt/boot you should see the kernel for example config-2.6.31-10-generic but i dont have it
well you mounted some partition that should have /mnt/boot in it but it's not there?
maybe I need the whole command you gave it
opps ok sorry missed that above
ok you ls /mnt and don't see the /mnt/boot dir
ok from what I see seems your system files are ok but the grub2 is mest up
do you have a ubuntu live cd boot disk?
can you boot your live ubuntu cd?
ok well I see a problem that I'm not used to playing with your ubuntu is not on your sda drive
it's not imposible to configure grub to boot from there
what version of ubuntu are we booting
I asume you didn't override and make it boot with the old grub and now uses grub2
well I think you can just boot the live cd and reinstall grub
oh your running on it now
no problem I'll go private see my private mesage
